section.title: Introduction
section.para: Welcome to the Jetty Documentation Wiki. Jetty is an open-source project providing an HTTP server, HTTP client, and javax.servlet container. This Jetty Wiki provides information about getting started with Jetty, basic configuration, specific features, optimization, security, JavaEE, monitoring, FAQs, help with troubleshooting, and more. It includes tutorials, howtos, videos, feature descriptions, and reference materials.

section.title: Proposed Usage

listitem.para: raw content comes from developers (and the existing wiki)
developers can checkout the git project and create sections as features or changes to existing work, new documentaiton in other words
we can make an incoming directory in the structure here that developers commit new raw content to
shirley can be responsible for taking raw content and organizing into the chosen structure
we can all edit and update existing documentation, but new content generally goes to incoming

section.para:
Releasing is easy
Note the Version section in the top toc, we have a way of injecting values into the generation
on release we update the pom.xml and set the version numbers, 6, 7 and 8 that the document covers
commit that and then we run normal maven release process
mvn release:prepare
mvn release:perform
we can consume the documentation from maven central while building out our distribution
we can also bundle up the html and deploy it to download.eclipse.org/jetty/documentation
